title: How to put XB21 into double/stereo modeo
text:
Instead of just repeating what everyone else wrote about the app (which is all true), let me tell you the steps to put XB21 (and similar?) speakers into double or stereo mode. 

#1) Do not follow their instructions. 

#2) Download this app but do not open. 

#3) Take the first speaker and turn it on. 

#4) Press and Hold Power Button. The Bluetooth icon will flash quickly. 

#5) Go to your General Settings, click Bluetooth (will show SRS-XB21 at the bottom), and wait until it has connected. The speaker will also give you a 2-tone beep.  Note, other Sony speakers may have a Bluetooth button.

#6)  Click on the blue ‘i’ circle beside the connected speaker (on your Bluetooth settings on your phone) and disconnect it. 

#7) Follow steps #3-5 to add additional speaker. Disconnect from bluetooth additional speaker you just added and click connect on first speaker. 

#8) Go to the app. Agree to their terms of service, etc. 

#9) You should see a speaker at top. Click to Edit Speaker Group. It will take you to another screen and should show you the second speaker you added. 

#10) Click to Add speakers. This will link them into double mode. From there you can change them to Stereo if you want via the Edit Group button.

title: Needs improvement
text: I like that it can play music from so many different sources, but there's one thing that's annoying me. I see that once I'm on the station and I navigate around Pandora, there is a Play arrow that will take me to the current song, but that Play button isn't there after I've exited the app and I come back to it. text: This app was great. It used to control my stereo with ease. I use it to control streaming to my outside speakers. At least I did before the recent updates. This app has become worthless. title: My first review!

title: Why take away the old software that worked with my receiver??
text: When I got the Sony receiver that worked with this older software song pal I didn't even need a new receiver I just wanted do use my phone to control it. title: Getting better!
text: Just tried the update to music center from SongPal, the interface is clean and easy to navigate. I have only found one small problem so far, but it's not a major issue. title: What does it do exactly?
text: Hooked up my iPhone 6 via USB and paired it with Bluetooth. It made me download this app, which makes Pandora only controllable by the head unit or remote control. Idk what else it does since my phone paired with the head unit I can call and receive calls easily. If I could look at the Pandora on my phone while also streaming to my head unit it'd be great. I also agree with sgnwinder, as every time I get in my car I don't want to look at my phone to accept the app. What's the point of auto connect if it asks every single time and I have to pull my phone out of my pocket?

title: Are you KIDDING ME!
text: My STR DN-1050 has been in storage for about 6-months while we moved the fam to a new state, then we finally buy a house and I pull out the receiver and hook up to our brand new Sony 55” 4K UHD... only to find out the app no longer supports simple remote functions. title: Really Bad
text: This app needs a ton of work.  Works about 20% of time. When it does work every time I just want to adjust the sound settings or any other setting, I can't just toggle between apps on my phone.  If I click away from the screen, the initial screen I was on will go away and I have to go back to the main menu and go through all the submenus to get back to where I was in the first place.  Not only that, just to get to use the main menu after clicking the app again(after never actually shutting down the app) it takes way too long to load the menu commands.  Never seen an app so bad.  Hopefully Sony can listen to their customers' issues.

title: Works wonderful
text: Installed a new Sony marine stereo on my boat with wet sound amp and speakers I have an iPhone 6 and my wife has a Motorola smart phone apps installed both phones work phenomenal can't express enough how wonderful it is to be anywhere in the sited  position on the boat and control sound and music 😎 I don't like Sony products however the install person suggested this radio we can still control with remote from factory installed remote love ❤️ the Glastron GTS 245 and wet sounds and JBL and bazooka subs

title: Songpal needs work.
text: This app is very frustrating in how you have to navigate a dlna library. When you get to the artist list, you must scroll through the whole library. No search or shortcut. When you select an album, the songs are listed in alphabetical order instead of track order. It's a shame that this is our only choice for the Sony products.

title: Poor Software Lifecycle Planning
text:
Look, I'm another guy in the 1050 boat as all of the other complaints.  I'm fortunately one of the few who read the note to NOT upgrade to the latest build, but here's the problem-- what happens when I get a new iPhone and my OS automatically pulls the latest build from the App Store?

title: Could not re add my device!!!
text: So I’ve had my Sony xb-40 for about 2 months and have had no issues but this app causes major issues for me. title: No longer compatible with my system??
text: I would steer clear of purchasing a Sony soundbar product if you plan to use their SongPal App - which is advertised to be used with it!!! title: Works efficiently
text: This app works very well and I no longer have to fear my speakers blowing out because I have more control over my music, however a nice integration to this app would be background refresh so that way it always is communicating with the stereo and I'm not exactly sure it works once you leave the app or at least it doesn't seem as it does with my stereo other than those minor flaws everything checks out quite well and I'm very pleased with the app

title: Works well with Soundbar
text: I have the HTNT5 sound bar and this works just like it should.  I have had no issues with connection or lag.  The app is pretty straight forward and easy to use with my sound bar.   It allows me to switch between inputs with ease and even allows me to play music from my phone over wifi while giving a display with the song information on the tv.

title: Not Bad
text:
Not bad compared to the others - not simple but not too advanced. To be able to adjust MOST settings (minus a few like crossover I believe) without touching the GUI or amp menu in the middle of a movie is fantastic. 

The only annoying part is having to wait on it to reconnect or having to select it if you pause the app. Obviously this is for battery purposes on the phone but it should be a user selectable time out that way someone like me can just utilize it more.

title: Does not control my receiver
text: I too, like so many others, have a Sony receiver I bought 2 years ago, and can not be controlled by the updated SongPal. So I have to be very careful not to update SongPal. I have a constant reminder in my App Store that I have an App to update, and I can’t ever tap “Update All”. title: Does what it says, but a bit limited
text:
The app has worked as advertised for me, and I've been consistently able to connect my iPhone 6+ on iOS 8.1.2 to my Sony Receiver.

There is one issue I have, which may or may not be a limitation of the Bluetooth Interface:

title: Functionally sketchy and awful UI
text: Name changed but the bugginess remains with use for a VERY expensive RSX-GS9. The functionality of the app, that's REQUIRED for supposedly connecting and controlling USB memory media sources, is so blisteringly poor in connection and player performance, that it's made me reconsider the unit altogether.  The first high quality Sony head unit in many many years ($1500 folks) with outstanding sound quality.. However it's rendered nearly useless in dash because of this app.  It's easier to run coaxial from a Fiio DAP than the GS9 head unit using this app.

title: The most frustrating of hundreds of apps on my own!

title: Usless with MEX-N5100 Radio
text: I recently bought a used Toyota Truck where the previous owner installed a Sony MEX-N5100 in place of original equipment. title: Could not add a device
text: I've had my SRS:-X2 speaker for a couple years. title: False advertising?

title: Works but could be a bit crisper

title: No Longer a Sony Customer

title: Great App!!

title: Okay as of now
